title: Darren Wright (rugby league)
text:
Darren Wright (born 17 January 1968) is an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1980s and 1990s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain Under-21s</a>, and as an <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a> for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, and at club level in England as a or for <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> and in Australia for the <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">North Sydney Bears</a>.
Background.
Darren Wright was born in <a href="Leigh%2C%20Greater%20Manchester">Leigh</a>, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>, England.
Playing career.
Wright was selected to go on the <a href="1988%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour">1988 Great Britain Lions tour</a>, and appeared in one <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20league%29">test match</a>. During the <a href="1989%E2%80%9390%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1989–90 Rugby Football League season</a>, he played for defending champions Widnes at centre in their <a href="1989%20World%20Club%20Challenge">1989 World Club Challenge</a> victory against the visiting <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a>. Darren Wright played , i.e. number 2, in <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a>' 24-18 victory over <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a> in the <a href="1990%20Lancashire%20Cup">1990</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1990%E2%80%9391%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1990–91 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 29 September 1990.
Darren Wright played left-, i.e. number 4, and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a>' 6-12 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="1988%E2%80%9389%20League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">1988–89</a> <a href="League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">John Player Special Trophy</a> Final during the <a href="1988%E2%80%9389%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1988–89 season</a> at <a href="Burnden%20Park">Burnden Park</a>, <a href="Bolton">Bolton</a> on Saturday 7 January 1989, and played left-, i.e. number 4, in the 24-0 victory over <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the <a href="1991%E2%80%9392%20League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">1991–92</a> <a href="League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">Regal Trophy</a> Final during the <a href="1991%E2%80%9392%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1991–92 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 11 January 1992.
Darren Wright's <a href="Testimonial%20match">Testimonial match</a> at <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> took place in 1995.
